movesets.name: Choice Scarf

items.name: Choice Scarf
items.description: Hold item which raises Speed by 50%, but locks holder into one move.

movesets.description:
Moves

Flare Blitz is Darmanitan's STAB attack, which is extremely powerful when you consider that latter's large Attack stat and Sheer Force. U-turn is used to allow Darmanitan to gain momentum, and it is also great for picking off weakened threats. Rock Slide is Darmanitan's main way to hit opposing Fire-types, something that would otherwise give it trouble. Superpower is used in the last slot to hit Steel-types which take neutral damage from Flare Blitz, such as Empoleon. Earthquake can be used over Superpower if the Attack drop is found to be annoying, though it is weaker, and being Choice-locked into Earthquake is something an opponent can easily take advantage of.

Set Details

Choice Scarf is the item of choice for this set as it makes Darmanitan extremely fast, allowing it to take out otherwise faster threats. Sheer Force is the best ability for Darmanitan, as it gives a 30% boost to Flare Blitz and Rock Slide. Maximum Attack and Speed are used to make Darmanitan as powerful and fast as possible, while 4 Special Defense EVs makes sure it doesn't give Pokemon with the ability Download a Special Attack boost. A Jolly nature is used to further increase Darmantian's Speed and make it as fast as possible. An Adamant nature can also be used for more power, but Darmanitan then loses to other Choice Scarf users, such as Krookodile, Porygon-Z, and Nidoking.

Usage Tips

U-turn will be the move Darmanitan usually uses most, even more than Flare Blitz, as it allows Darmanitan to easily gain momentum for its team. As such, if you predict a switch into one of Darmanitan's counters, don't be afraid to go for U-turn. It is best to try and have Stealth Rock and Spikes off the field at all times, as they can easily wear Darmanitan down. Finally, with a Choice Scarf, Darmanitan is a great revenge killer, and as such should be used to revenge kill faster threats.

Team Options

Rapid Spin or Defog support is necessary, as Darmanitan is prone to being worn down by Stealth Rock. Good users of the move include Starmie, Flygon, Mega Blastoise, Crobat,and Mega Aerodactyl. Pokemon with U-turn and Volt Switch such as Mienshao, Raikou, Flygon, and Noivern can help keep up offensive pressure and momentum. Grass-types such as Roserade and Shaymin can deal with the Water- and Rock-type Pokemon which resist Darmanitan's STAB. Roserade can also set up Spikes for Darmanitan, allowing it to more easily net KOs. Electric-types such as Raikou can also threaten Water-types and keep momentum up with Volt Switch. Finally, Chesnaught and Hippowdon are helpful partners which can absorb the Ground- and Rock-type moves Darmanitan hates.

movesets.name: Wallbreaker

items.name: Choice Band
items.description: Raises Attack by 50%, but locks the user into one move.

items.name: Life Orb
items.description: Boosts power by 30%, user takes 10% recoil each turn it attacks.

movesets.description:
Moves

Flare Blitz is Darmanitan's main STAB attack, and it is very powerful with Sheer Force and its high base Attack stat. U-turn is a great move for gaining momentum and can also be used to pick off weakened threats. Rock Slide is Darmanitan's best option against Fire-types, and it is also boosted by Sheer Force. Superpower is used to hit Steel-types who take neutral damage from Flare Blitz, such as Empoleon. Earthquake is another option over Superpower if the Attack drop is found to be annoying, although it's weaker. It's also easy for the opponent to take advantage of Earthquake if you decide to run a Choice Band.

Set Details

Life Orb is a great item for Darmanitan, which takes no Life Orb recoil due to Sheer Force, and it makes its attacks even more powerful. A Choice Band set can also be used for extreme power. However, Darmanitan is very prone to being worn down, something that isn't very good for a wallbreaker. Sheer Force is the best ability, as it boosts the power of both Flare Blitz and Rock Slide. Maximum Attack and Speed are used to make Darmanitan as fast and as powerful as possible, while 4 Special Defense EVs ensures that Darmanitan doesn't give Pokemon with the ability Download a Special Attack boost. A Jolly nature makes Darmanitan as fast as possible, something needed when not running a Choice Scarf.

Usage Tips

Because Sheer Force negates Life Orb recoil on moves that have secondary effects, Darmanitan can bluff a Choice Scarf as long as it doesn't use U-turn, Earthquake, or Superpower, or switch moves on the Life Orb set. Choice Band can also allow Darmanitan to do this, but your opponent will usually notice it's Choice Banded after it fires off its first Flare Blitz. Stealth Rock and Spikes are great at wearing Darmanitan down, and as such they should be kept off the field as much as possible. U-turn is great for gaining momentum, so don't be afraid to use it if you predict a switch into one of Darmanitan's counters. Life Orb and Choice Band Darmanitan are powerful attackers, so try to dish out as much damage as possible before Darmanitan faints.

Team Options

Rapid Spin or Defog support is necessary in order to keep Darmanitan alive for extended periods of time. Good users of the move include Starmie, Flygon, Mega Blastoise, Crobat, and Mega Aerodactyl. Pokemon with U-turn and Volt Switch, such as Mienshao, Raikou, Flygon, and Noivern, are also helpful partners, as they can keep up offensive pressure and momentum. Grass-types such as Roserade and Shaymin make great partners, as they can deal with Water- and Rock-type Pokemon for Darmanitan. Roserade can also set up Spikes, allowing Darmanitan to wallbreak more easily. Electric-types such as Raikou can threaten Water-types while also gaining momentum with Volt Switch. Sticky Web support from the likes of Smeargle and Galvantula can be very helpful against faster teams. Finally, Pokemon such as Chesnaught and Hippowdon can also help absorb Rock- and Ground-type moves for Darmanitan.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Belly Drum
moves.description: User loses 50% of max HP. Maximizes Attack.

moves.name: Brick Break
moves.description: Destroys Light Screen and Reflect, then hits.

moves.name: Bulk Up
moves.description: Boosts Attack and Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Bulldoze
moves.description: Lowers target's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Dig
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Earthquake
moves.description: Hits Pokemon using Dig with double Base Power.

moves.name: Encore
moves.description: Causes the target to repeat the last move for 2-5 turns.

moves.name: Endeavor
moves.description: Lowers the target's HP to the user's HP.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Fire Blast
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Fire Fang
moves.description: 10% chance to flinch. 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Fire Punch
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Flame Charge
moves.description: Boosts user's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Flame Wheel
moves.description: 10% chance to burn. Thaws the user.

moves.name: Flamethrower
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Flare Blitz
moves.description: Has 1/3 recoil. 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Fling
moves.description: Throws the user's hold item at the foe. Power and effect depend on the item.

moves.name: Focus Blast
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Focus Energy
moves.description: Boosts critical hit rate by 1 stage.

moves.name: Focus Punch
moves.description: Fails if the user takes damage before it hits.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Giga Impact
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Grass Knot
moves.description: Deals damage based on the foe's weight.

moves.name: Gyro Ball
moves.description: Does damage based on the foe's Speed and the user's Speed.

moves.name: Hammer Arm
moves.description: Lowers user's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Headbutt
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch the target.

moves.name: Heat Wave
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Hidden Power Bug
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hyper Beam
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Incinerate
moves.description: Removes the target's Berry.

moves.name: Overheat
moves.description: Lowers Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Payback
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe has taken its turn.

moves.name: Power-Up Punch
moves.description: Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Psychic
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense 1 stage.

moves.name: Rage
moves.description: Boosts Atk 1 stage if hit.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Roar
moves.description: Forces a switch to a random Pokemon.

moves.name: Rock Slide
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Rock Smash
moves.description: 50% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Rock Tomb
moves.description: Lowers Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Rollout
moves.description: Doubles in power with each hit. Repeats for 5 turns.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Smack Down
moves.description: Can hit if target is using Fly, Bounce, or Sky Drop. Ends target's airborne moves and its benefits from Flying type or Levitate.

moves.name: Snatch
moves.description: If certain moves are used, the user of Snatch uses the moves instead.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Solar Beam
moves.description: Charges up turn 1; attacks on turn 2.

moves.name: Stone Edge
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Strength
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.name: Superpower
moves.description: Lowers the user's Attack and Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Tackle
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Take Down
moves.description: Has 1/4 recoil.

moves.name: Taunt
moves.description: Forces the foe to use damaging moves for 2 turns.

moves.name: Thief
moves.description: Steals target's item.

moves.name: Thrash
moves.description: Repeats for 2-3 turns. Confuses the user.

moves.name: Torment
moves.description: Prevents the target from using the same move twice in a row.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: U-turn
moves.description: Attacks, then switches.

moves.name: Uproar
moves.description: Repeats for 2-5 turns. No Pokemon can sleep during these turns.

moves.name: Will-O-Wisp
moves.description: Burns the foe.

moves.name: Work Up
moves.description: Boosts user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Yawn
moves.description: Puts the target to sleep after 2 turns.

moves.name: Zen Headbutt
moves.description: 20% chance to flinch.

abilities.name: Sheer Force
abilities.description: Increases power of moves with secondary effects by 30%, but removes the effects.

abilities.name: Zen Mode
abilities.description: The wielder changes forme when below 50% of its max HP.
